com.skilltradiez.skilltraderz

Class DatabaseController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.skilltradiez.skilltraderz.DatabaseController

  • public final class DatabaseController
extends java.lang.Object
    Following MVC styling to the absolute core, this is taking out of the UserDatabase anything but the most bare minimal methods. We're maintaing the model as the model, and we're making all the other functionality be housed here. This area will take care of anything and everything the rest of the program may possibly want to do with the database.

    • Method Detail

      • getUserDB

        public UserDatabase getUserDB()
        Returns the user database object, the one used for the entire application. This method should not be called EVER outside of controllers to follow strict MVC methods. ...Please... :(
        Returns:
        UserDatabase object, the core database of the application.

      • refresh

        public static void refresh()
        This method when invoked will take all of the current various parts of the model of the application and put them into the database. Upon failure, will return an IOException.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • save

        public static void save()
        This method when called will update the MasterController's model with the current data within the application.

                          throws UserAlreadyExistsException,
                                 NoInternetException

      • deleteDocumentUser

        public static void deleteDocumentUser(ID userID)
        Deletes the given ID (USER ID!) from the model of the application. Yes, if you look at the code it looks similar to the other delete document functions. BUT there is a very critical string flag that is going to differentiate to the elastic function on WHAT is being deleted.
        Parameters:
        userID - ID Object for a particular USER.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • deleteDocumentSkill

        public static void deleteDocumentSkill(ID skillID)
        Deletes the given ID (SKILL ID!) from the model of the application. Yes, if you look at the code it looks similar to the other delete document functions. BUT there is a very critical string flag that is going to differentiate to the elastic function on WHAT is being deleted.
        Parameters:
        skillID - ID object for a particular SKILL.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • deleteDocumentTrade

        public static void deleteDocumentTrade(ID tradeID)
        Deletes the given ID (TRADE ID!) from the model of the application. Yes, if you look at the code it looks similar to the other delete document functions. BUT there is a very critical string flag that is going to differentiate to the elastic function on WHAT is being deleted.
        Parameters:
        tradeID - ID Object for a particular TRADE.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • updateElasticDocument

        public static <T> void updateElasticDocument(java.lang.String type,
                                             java.lang.String id,
                                             T data,
                                             java.lang.String path)
                                      throws java.io.IOException
        This method will update the elastic document paired with the user database with the updated information passed into this method.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Elastic Search requires a T type to be utilized.
        Parameters:
        type - Input string for a type, NOT an Object.
        id - Input string for an ID, NOT an Object.
        data - Elastic search requires the use of a T type.
        path - Input string for a path to be utilized by elastic. NOT an Object.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
